title: About
text:
üëãüèª I‚Äôm Larry, a German based in Stockholm, who recently finished her Master thesis on deceptive design patterns.
I use design to create understanding, spark compassion, and drive action. I work with user studies and user experience design. Sometimes I also code, like this website. You‚Äôll usually find me talking about value-sensitive design, initiatives and people that drive climate action, or great data visualization.
In real life, I enjoy focal things (as A. Borgmann would put it); being in nature on a hike. The smell of roasted onions in the pan. Feeling the strain in my body during a run.

I‚Äôm Larry, a German based in Stockholm, who recently finished her Master thesis on deceptive design patterns.
I use design to create understanding, spark compassion, and drive action. I work with user studies and user experience design. Sometimes I also code, like this website. You‚Äôll usually find me talking about value-sensitive design, initiatives and people that drive climate action, or great data visualization.
In real life, I enjoy focal things (as A. Borgmann would put it); being in nature on a hike. The smell of roasted onions in the pan. Feeling the strain in my body during a run.
Contrary to popular belief, Lorem Ipsum is not simply random text. It has roots in a piece of classical Latin literature from 45 BC, making it over 2000 years old. Richard McClintock, a Latin professor at Hampden-Sydney College in Virginia, looked up one of the more obscure Latin words, consectetur, from a Lorem Ipsum passage, and going through the cites of the word in classical literature, discovered the undoubtable source. Lorem Ipsum comes from sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 of ‚Äúde Finibus Bonorum et Malorum‚Äù (The Extremes of Good and Evil) by Cicero, written in 45 BC. This book is a treatise on the theory of ethics, very popular during the Renaissance. The first line of Lorem Ipsum, ‚ÄúLorem ipsum dolor sit amet..‚Äù, comes from a line in section 1.10.32.
The standard chunk of Lorem Ipsum used since the 1500s is reproduced below for those interested. Sections 1.10.32 and 1.10.33 from ‚Äúde Finibus Bonorum et Malorum‚Äù by Cicero are also reproduced in their exact original form, accompanied by English versions from the 1914 translation by H. Rackham.

title: Designing to support user agency
text: Der Polar-Birkenzeisig (Acanthis hornemanni, Syn.: Carduelis hornemanni) ist ein Singvogel aus der Gattung Acanthis in der Familie der Finken (Fringillidae).

title: Designing to support user agency
text: Der Polar-Birkenzeisig (Acanthis hornemanni, Syn.: Carduelis hornemanni) ist ein Singvogel aus der Gattung Acanthis in der Familie der Finken (Fringillidae).

title: Designing to support user agency
text:
Beschreibung
Der 13 bis 15 Zentimeter messende Vogel √§hnelt dem Birkenzeisig, ist aber heller und wirkt bereift. Der B√ºrzel ist ungestreift und rein wei√ü, auch die auff√§lligen Fl√ºgelbinden sind wei√ü. Der R√ºcken hat eine graue F√§rbung und hebt sich vom hellen Kopf und der hellen, wenig gestreiften Unterseite sattelartig ab.
Die Brust des M√§nnchens hat nur einen schwachen rosa Anflug, dem Weibchen fehlt der r√∂tliche Farbton. M√§nnchen und Weibchen tragen einen karminroten Scheitel. Seine Stimme √§hnelt dem des Birkenzeisigs, die einzelnen T√∂ne sind aber klarer voneinander getrennt.



Redpoll

title: Designing to support user agency
text:
Lebensraum
Es gibt zwei Unterarten, A. h. hornemanni aus Gr√∂nland und den kanadischen Nachbarinseln sowie A. h. exilipes aus Nordamerika und Eurasien. Die gr√∂nl√§ndische Unterart ist gr√∂√üer und heller, manchmal √ºberwiegend wei√ü. In Europa br√ºtet der Polar-Birkenzeisig nur im n√∂rdlichsten Skandinavien. Im Winter h√§lt er sich im gesamten Skandinavien und im Baltikum auf, Umherstreifende gelangen bis Island, Gro√übritannien und Mitteleuropa.

title: Designing to support user agency
text:
Lebensweise
Acanthis hornemanni exilipes Er ist f√ºr gew√∂hnlich ein Vogel der Tundra, der in Zwergbirken und niedrigem Gestr√ºpp br√ºtet. Das Gelege besteht aus vier bis f√ºnf Eiern, nach 9 bis 14 Tagen sind die Jungen fl√ºgge. Birkensamen, daneben auch Insekten, sind die Hauptnahrung des Polar-Birkenzeisigs. An mehreren Stellen, zum Beispiel im n√∂rdlichen Norwegen, bildet er unbeschr√§nkt Mischpaare mit dem Birkenzeisig.

title: Green Kolding
text:
Die Wasseramsel oder Eurasische Wasseramsel (Cinclus cinclus) ist die einzige auch in Mitteleuropa vorkommende Vertreterin der Familie der Wasseramseln (Cinclidae). Der etwa starengro√üe, rundlich wirkende Singvogel ist eng an das Leben entlang schnellflie√üender, klarer Gew√§sser gebunden. Dort ern√§hrt sich die Art vornehmlich von Wasserinsekten, die sie vor allem tauchend erbeutet.
Die Art erbaut umfangreiche Kugelnester in Halbh√∂hlen oder nat√ºrlichen H√∂hlen entlang ihrer Nahrungsgew√§sser, in Uferverbauungen sowie unter Br√ºcken und anderen flussbegleitenden Bauwerken. Sie ist ein Standvogel (d.¬†h. kein Zugvogel) und verl√§sst die Brutgew√§sser nur, wenn sie zufrieren.
Die Wasseramsel ist mit 13 Unterarten von Westeuropa und Nordwestafrika ostw√§rts bis in die Region um den Baikalsee und in die Hochlagen Westchinas verbreitet.
Nach starken Einbu√üen in der zweiten H√§lfte des 20. Jh. haben sich die Best√§nde der meisten Unterarten weitgehend erholt. Die Art gilt nach Einsch√§tzung der IUCN als nicht gef√§hrdet (Least Concern).
Die Wasseramsel ist seit 1963 der Nationalvogel Norwegens.[1]

title: Green Kolding
text:
Die Wasseramsel oder Eurasische Wasseramsel (Cinclus cinclus) ist die einzige auch in Mitteleuropa vorkommende Vertreterin der Familie der Wasseramseln (Cinclidae). Der etwa starengro√üe, rundlich wirkende Singvogel ist eng an das Leben entlang schnellflie√üender, klarer Gew√§sser gebunden. Die Art erbaut umfangreiche Kugelnester in Halbh√∂hlen oder nat√ºrlichen H√∂hlen entlang ihrer Nahrungsgew√§sser, in Uferverbauungen sowie unter Br√ºcken und anderen flussbegleitenden Bauwerken. Sie ist ein Standvogel (d.¬†h. kein Zugvogel) und verl√§sst die Brutgew√§sser nur, wenn sie zufrieren.
Die Wasseramsel ist mit 13 Unterarten von Westeuropa und Nordwestafrika ostw√§rts bis in die Region um den Baikalsee und in die Hochlagen Westchinas verbreitet.
Nach starken Einbu√üen in der zweiten H√§lfte des 20. Jh. haben sich die Best√§nde der meisten Unterarten weitgehend erholt. Die Art gilt nach Einsch√§tzung der IUCN als nicht gef√§hrdet (Least Concern).
Die Wasseramsel ist seit 1963 der Nationalvogel Norwegens.[1]

title: Every design is political
text:
Though he rejects what he calls ‚Äúna√Øve technological determinism,‚Äù Winner argues that ‚Äúcertain technologies in themselves have political properties.‚Äù He indicates two ways in which this occurs:
‚Äúthe invention, design, or arrangement of a specific technical device or system becomes a way of settling an issue in the affairs of a particular community‚Äù or ‚Äúinherently political technologies‚Äù which ‚Äúappear to require or to be strongly compatible with particular kinds of political relationships.‚Äù Technical Arrangements and Social Order The most commonly cited example from Winner‚Äôs essay is the height of the bridges over park ways on Long Island. Robert Moses build them according to specifications that would discourage the presence of buses. ‚ÄúOne consequence was to limit access of racial minorities and low-income groups to Jones Beach, Moses‚Äô widely acclaimed public park. Moses made doubly sure of this result by vetoing a proposed extension of the Long Island Roach to Jones Beach. This is a demonstration of technological design that enforced a particular political agenda. Lessig cites this as a case of architecture being used as a modality of constraint on behavior.
Winner provides other examples of consciously political design: I mean, it‚Äôs pretty cool that content can go in the margin, right??  It could even be a picture:  The book page reads verdere expedities which is Dutch for ‚Äúfurther expeditions‚Äù
‚ÄúBaron Haussmann‚Äôs broad Parisian thoroughfares, engineered at Louis Napoleon‚Äôs direction to prevent any recurrence of street fighting of the kind that took place during the revolution of 1848,‚Äù ‚Äúconcrete buildings and huge plazas constructed on university campuses in the United States during the late 1960s and early 1970 to defuse student demonstrations,‚Äù Cyrus McCormick‚Äôs introduction of pneumatic molding machines into his Chicago reaper manufacturing plant in the 1880s, in order to ‚Äúweed out‚Äù the skilled workers who had organized a local union. Winner points out, however, that ‚Äúto recognize the political dimensions in the shapes of technology does not require that we look for conscious conspiracies or malicious intentions.‚Äù There are other interesting cases in which ‚Äúthe technological deck has been stacked in advance in favor of certain social interests,‚Äù even though this stacking may not have been a conscious choice on anyone‚Äôs part:
Failure to accommodate for individuals with disabilities has arisen ‚Äúmore from long-standing neglect than from anyone‚Äôs active intention.‚Äù Many recent federal regulations have been written to address this neglect. The introduction of mechanical tomato harvesters inspires the breading of new varieties of tomatoes, which are able to better handle the machinery‚Äôs rough motion. The combination of new equipment and new tomato breeds has had a dramatic effect on farm communities, which have been displaced by large agri-businesses. Inherently Political Technologies Many technologies, Winner argues, are inherently political, since their very creation and operation requires specific social arrangements:
Plato‚Äôs Republic emphasized that ‚Äúno reasonable person believes that ships can be run democratically,‚Äù since their operation requires the coordination of so many individual workers. Large ships require social hierarchies that one-person canoes do not. Friedrich Engels pointed out that complex technical systems, such as large production factories, can serve as a means to reinforce centralized control. As the systems get more complex, ‚Äúcentral control by knowledgeable people acting at the top of a rigid social hierarchy would seem increasingly prudent.‚Äù Winner also quotes Jerry Mander, who explains that ‚Äúif you accept nuclear power plants, you also accept a techno-scientific industrial-military elite. Without these people in charge, you could not have nuclear power.‚Äù Conversely, environmental activist have often lauded the democratizing qualities of solar energy, which tends to work against the concentration of power in the hands of large institutions. ‚ÄúTaking the most obvious example, the atom bomb is an inherently political artifact. As long as it exists at all, its lethal properties demand that it be controlled by a centralized, rigidly hierarchical, chain of command closed to all influences that might make its workings unpredictable.‚Äù This is a ‚Äúmatter of practical necessity independent of any larger political system in which the bomb is embedded.‚Äù Implications: Winner‚Äôs arguments can be important to both creators and consumers of new technology. Winner points out that the political nature of certain technologies have been used by both ends of the political spectrum. And designers of roads have purposely specified the height of bridges to keep populations of lower socio-economic status out of certain areas.
When considering technological change, Winner identifies two broad types of choices:
‚Äúyes or no‚Äù on whether to adopt a new technology and ‚Äúspecial features in the design or arrangement of a technical system‚Äù for which the answer to the first choice was ‚Äúyes.‚Äù The most important thing to recognize about these choices is that they often go far being pragmatic concerns about what tool would be best or most cost-effective for a given job. Many amount to the selection of ‚Äúforms of life,‚Äù since they embody certain possibilities more than others. The ‚Äúgreatest latitude of choice exists the very first time a particular instrument, system, or technique is introduced,‚Äù so ‚Äúthe same careful attention that one would give to the rules, roles, and relationships of politics must also be given‚Äù to such technological choices. In contemporary society, such decisions are often not recognized as such. The advancement of certain ends has become so ingrained in our thinking that we fail to recognize reasons other than those of practical necessity toward those ends. ‚ÄúIn many instances, to say that some technologies are inherently political is to say that certain widely accepted reasons of practical necessity‚Äîespecially the need to maintain crucial technological systems as smoothly working entities‚Äîhave tended to eclipse other sorts of moral and political reasoning.‚Äù
For many areas of ICT implementation, we are still fortunate to be at an early enough stage that such a latitude of choice is available to us. ICTs that are introduced into an environment can embody specific social arrangements and continuously reinforce those arrangements through the possibilities (what are often called ‚Äúaffordances‚Äù) for action that they imply.
Considering such consequences is essential, in order to introduce technologies in ways that will advance, rather than hinder, the social values that the Kellogg Foundation espouses. It is important not to simply accept the incentive to join the forces of technological ‚Äúprogress‚Äù at face value. ‚ÄúIn our times people are often willing to make drastic changes in the why they live to accommodate technological innovation while at the same time resisting similar kinds of changes justified on political grounds. If for no other reason than that, it is important for us to achieve a clearer view of these matters than has been our habit so far.‚Äù

title: Portfolio
text:
Here‚Äôs what I do: my work ranges from projects in interdisciplanary teams, assignments during my time at Syddansk Universitetet in Denmark, to projects of my own in my spare time. These projects all share one common characteristic, though: their course of progress was far from linear. Which is why I aim to describe each project as a whole, including its detours and setbacks. After all, failure is part of the design process! 
Apart from that, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out if you want to know more about a specific project.















Designing to support user agency



values


design


Design Thinking



In my Master Thesis, I explore and redesign design mechanisms on Instagram for a greater sense of user agency.













Green Kolding



UX


User studies


Sustainability



Green Kolding is a youth organization in Kolding.
